posts.cooked: What is the circuit breaker rupture curve used in FRC? The 120A.

posts.name: Mark McLeod
posts.cooked:
There are two types of main 120a breakers that have come in the KOP. This is the older one: https://www.team358.org/files/electrical/120aMainBreaker.pdf This is the newer one: https://www.team358.org/files/electrical/Optifuse153-120amainbreaker.pdf

[edit] added the second after electroken posted

posts.name: Ken Pontbriant
posts.cooked: And I believe this is the other one:

posts.name: Leo
posts.cooked:
A little off topic from what you where asking, but seeing that you are on a rookie team, I just wanted to point out that the newer breaker has been found to have a lot more safety issues and failures then the old one. So even though the Optifuse is given out in the KOP , I highly recommend buying the older breaker.

One rule change that will improve everyone's season: Ban the Optifuse! FIRST

link_counts.title: One rule change that will improve everyone's season: Ban the Optifuse!

posts.cooked: Thank you, it helped a lot
